greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table read by rows: first row is {1}; for n >1, T(n, k) is the k-th largest prime factor of n (repeated prime factors are counted repeatedly).
comment: n-th row has length 1 if n = 1, A001222(n) if n > 1.
link: Peter Kagey, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Row n is row n of A027746 in reverse order.
program: a238689_row n = a n [] a000040_list where
| m `mod` p == 0 = a (m `div` p) (p : factors) ps
xref: First column is A006530; numbers along right boundary form A020639.
results.author: _Matthew Vandermast_, Apr 28 2014
